About

I am a Ph. D. student major in applied mathematics and statistics at Stanford. My research is motivated by data science, and lies at the intersection of statistics, machine learning, information theory, and computer science. I often build on insights that originated within the statistical physics literature. Here is my Homepage.

In my first several blogs, I will discuss about methods from statistical physics and random matrix theory. Hope you will have fun here!

Entropic Flow

A research blog about machine learning and statistics.
